summary: HTTPS is a secure version of the web's communication language, HTTP. It adds a layer of protection called encryption, ensuring your data is safe when sent between your computer and websites. This prevents hackers from reading or changing your information. Websites use HTTPS to keep your personal details private, especially during online shopping or logging into accounts. It also verifies that you're connecting to the right website, stopping fake sites from tricking you. HTTPS has become very common, making the internet a safer place for everyone.
title: HTTPS
